Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include various types of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or bushes.
The student can include various types of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, or fish.
The student can show how the living things in one habitat are different from those in the other.
The student can observe patterns in the variety of plants and animals across the two habitats.
